content:
So I've found the following slides https://www.andrew.cmu.edu/user/avigad/meetings/fomm2020/slides/fomm_buzzard.pdf from @Kevin Buzzard 's talk. However I couldn't find the accompanying video of it.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dp-mQ3HxgDE is a talk with the same topic, but it uses different slides, which makes me think that there are two distinct talks.
Kevin gives several talks a month. I would be surprised if he keeps track of slides for each one of these
Not all talks I give get videoed and put on YouTube, is that the answer? In 2022-24 I gave over 100 talks.
The question is: Is there a video link of the talk with the given slides? I assume that it wasn't recorded/uploaded if not all talks get uploaded to youtube.
IIRC that particular talk was not videoed. It was the department colloquium at Pitt some time in 2020 just before Covid
The video you link to is a talk I gave in Seattle in 2019
Bummer, I wanted to watch that talk, it looked interesting.
